section.title: Reading
section.p: Before class, read Sections 1.1 and 1.2 of Applied Discrete Structures. Respond to the following question: How are the set operations union and intersection similar to the operations addition and multiplication on numbers, and how are they different?

Also, turn in solutions to these exercises:
List all elements of the following sets:
\{\frac{1}{n} \mid n \in \{3,4,5,6\}\}
\{x \in \mathbb{Z} \mid x = x+1 \}
\{n^2 \mid n = -2, -1, 0, 1, 2\}
\{n \in \mathbb{P} \mid n \textrm{ is a factor of 24 }\}
Let A = \{0, 2, 3\}, B = \{2, 3\}, C = \{1, 5, 9\}, D = \{3, 2\}, and E = \{2, 3, 2\}. Assume that the universal set is U = \{0, 1, 2, . . . , 9\}. Determine which of the following are true. Give reasons for your decisions.
A = B
B = C
B = D
E=D
A\cap B = B\cap A
A \cup B = B \cup A
A-B = B-A
A \oplus B = B \oplus A

li.p: Let U= \{1, 2, 3, . . . , 9\}. Find an example to illustrate that there are sets A and B such that A - B \neq B - A
Suppose that U is an infinite universal set, and A and B are infinite subsets of U. Answer the following questions with a brief explanation.
Find two sets A and B for which |A| = 5, |B| = 6, and |A\cup B| = 9. What is |A \cap B|?

For any sets A and B, define A\times B = \{(a,b) \mid a\in A \text{ and } b \in B\} and AB = \{ab \mid a\in A \text{ and } b \in B\}. If A = \{1,2\} and B = \{2,3,4\}, what is |A \times B|? What is |AB|?

A common data structure for a software implementation of sets is a bitmap. The way it works is if you want to work with subsets of a universe, U, with cardinality n you first establish an ordering of U when u_k is the kth element. A set A is then represented by a string of n bits b_1b_2\dots b_n when b_k is 1 if u_k \in A and is 0 otherwise. In the following questions, assume U=\{1,2,3,4,5\} with the ordering as listed.
What are the bit strings for the empty set and for U?
What are the bit strings for A=\{1,2,3\} and B=\{1,3,5\}?
What are the general rules for determining the the bit strings for A\cap B and A \cup B? What their bit strings in this particular case?
